intro: Lophiaris aurisasinora, commonly known as the ear-shaped lophiaris, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features distinctive, fleshy, ear-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white powder, known as farina. It produces small, yellowish flowers during the cooler months, typically in spring. Lophiaris aurisasinora is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
